snippet.description: The geography of Italy enhances the natural beauty and majesty of Europe. Learn more about the geography of Italy at HowStuffWorks...Italy, or the Italian Republic (Italian: Italia or Republica Italiana), a country in southern Europe. Jutting southward from the Alps...

snippet.title: Geography of Italy: Government
snippet.description: The government of Italy maintains the country's unique identity. Learn all about the government of Italy at HowStuffWorks...Italy set up its present form of government in 1946, when it changed from a monarchy to a republic headed by a president. The constitution of 1948...

snippet.title: Geography of Italy: The People
snippet.description: The people of Italy maintain their own traditions and culture. Learn all about the people of Italy at HowStuffWorks...PopulationIn 1991 Italy had a population of 57,103,833. Roughly a third of the population lived in or near the Po Valley; two-thirds lived north...

snippet.description: Tyrol, or Tirol, is a region of Western Central Europe that inlcudes parts of Austria and Italy.
